comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: Cheap fees, fast transactions. It's not really different from XRP when it comes to just about the coin and not the whole project behind it. I mean, XRP had its trouble while Tron does not and yet there are still people who are supporting it. Tron is cheap, and so do XRP. I like them both but I think Tron is widely used especially in online gambling platforms that accept it. I was once tipped by a gambler using TRX and that's when I got curious about it. I didn't know they are trying to use the real estate industry (if it's true) as their asset to keep their money from depreciating but I doubt this is a good idea. I think it's still better to keep it as a cryptocurrency because it will not be hit by inflation. Well, good luck to them.

comments.author: dwminer1
comments.body: Personally, I have had trx in my portfolio for a long time and I am happy with it. Back in the day, TRON blockhain was very popular for play-to-earn game dapps. A few years ago, using cryptocurrencies was not always as easy as it is now, and thanks to trx and wallets such as tronlink, transactions were very cheap and fast. Personally, I like cryptos that offer staking options, and with trx you can count on about 5% per year.
